discourse_list.title: Collateral Onboarding Call #47 | BlockTower Credit (Arranger) AMA

content.content: Collateral Onboarding Call #47 | BlockTower Credit (Arranger) AMA       Slides from the presentation  Application Summary BlockTower Credit has published a MIP6 application requesting a $150M initial debt ceiling to fund super-senior, asset-backed credit secured by short duration real-world loans and credit receivables. BlockTower Credit is the credit franchise of BlockTower Capital - an SEC-registered digital asset and blockchain investment firm. The firm manages over half-a-billion dollars and draws on decades of experience from ~30 professionals across investment, risk management, operations, data science, software development, legal and compliance functions.  Join us 2022-08-17T15:00:00Z as we host: Kevin Miao @humancapitol, Principal, Head of Credit Jack Carlisle @JackintheBlox, Principal, Director of Credit Kevin Chan @blockdataguy, Principal, Head of Credit Anant Matai @makeybakey , BlockTower Credit Team  If you’re unable to attend this call but have questions: submit any questions for the AMA on this forum post and our hosts will have them addressed during the session.  Agenda    Intro by @juan & @retro  Presentation by the BlockTower Credit Team Community Q&A   [MIP6]: BlockTower Credit (Arranger)   Summary of Terms  Counterparty: BlockTower Credit Real World Asset(s): Super-senior, asset-backed credit secured by diversified pools of short duration, real-world loans and credit receivables Initial Debt Ceiling: $150MM Minimum BlockTower Junior Capital Position: 30% junior capital (TIN) on every exposure 12-month goal: Demonstrate exemplary performance, scale responsibly, and play a critical role in raising the bar for Maker through RWA arranger efforts and governance participation Yield Benchmarks: SOFR (currently 1.53%) or like-term U.S. Treasuries (5-year UST currently ~2.715%) Stability Fee: 4% - Fixed    When Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-08-17T15:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where Youtube Recordingl  Attn: @SES-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @daif-core-unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance, @Recognized-Delegates, @collateral-core-unit, @data-insights-cu, @strat-fin-core-unit

Collateral Onboarding Call #47 - Summary August 17th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Retro  00:57: BlockTower Credit with Kevin Miao, Jack Carlisle, Kevin Chan, and Anant Matai  23:36: Q&A and Discussion about BlockTower Credit   Video https://youtu.be/LOQm8NxzR7w  Introduction  Retro  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello, MakerDAO community. Thank you for joining Collateral Onboarding Call #47. I am Retro from the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit. Today I am joined by BlockTower Credit to discuss the recently submitted MIP6 application requesting a $150M initial debt ceiling to fund super-senior, asset-backed credit secured by short-duration real-world loans and credit receivables. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.    BlockTower Credit  MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application: BlockTower Credit (Arranger)   Kevin Miao, Jack Carlisle, Kevin Chan, and Anant Matai  Presentation 00:57  BlockTower1920×1066 105 KB   Disclaimer1635×902 318 KB   Demand for RWAs on MakerDAO1632×890 154 KB   BlockTower Credit as an Arranger for RWAs on MakerDAO1631×895 151 KB   Our Investment Process1632×899 214 KB   Our Investment Focus1633×903 170 KB   High-Level Transactional Structure1630×898 169 KB   Discussion  23:36 - Raphael: What kind of loans have you previously dealt with? What are you most excited for in the next five years? 28:37 - PaperImperium: For funds flows, does BT require an intermediary (like HVBC and 6S use), or would BT directly receive the DAI? If an intermediary is required, can you provide some background? 33:25 - Frank Cruz: Can you please expand more regarding your proposed “fixed” stability fees? What is your thinking behind the proposed 4% SF? Why is it important that the stability fee is fixed? 37:59 - Robert Jordan: Can you comment on the portfolio and active management? 41:36 - Akrasia: How large is the junior tranche on these deals, and what is the yield on them? 44:21 - Robert Jordan: Can you comment on the utilization of the MIP21 and MIP22? 46:46 - Akrasia: In that context, MKR earns 4% on their senior stake, correct? Is this comparable to what a TradFi lender would expect from this risk profile? 49:56 - Tim B: Will this presentation end up on the forums?   Closing Comment  Retro  Outro 53:34  I want to thank the BlockTower Credit Team again. We would be happy to host you for a follow-up session anytime. Keep up to date at forum.makerdao.com    Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
